image.altText: A smiling young blonde woman.

props.synopsis: Queensland police have confirmed that the largest reward in the state's history has been paid out after the apprehension of Rajwinder Singh, who is accused of the 2018 murder of Toyah Cordingley.

title.children: $1m reward paid in full following arrest of Toyah Cordingley's alleged killer, police say

image.altText: A snake lies coiled on sand in the sun.

props.synopsis: The 47-year-old man suffered several snake bites before returning home to tell his wife, who applied first aid.

title.children: Wife desperately tried to save man fatally bitten by snake at Queensland childcare centre

image.altText: A woman in a dark dress, looking upset as she addresses the media.

props.synopsis: An intensive search found no trace of Scott Billingham, who has been missing for almost a fortnight. His partner is begging for anyone with information to come forward.

title.children: Partner makes emotional plea after mysterious disappearance of Queensland man

image.altText: A composite of headshots of both men speaking at microphones.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump uses an appearance on British television to insult Australia's ambassador to the US, Kevin Rudd, suggesting he might not remain in the role if the former president is re-elected.

title.children: Donald Trump insults ambassador Kevin Rudd, says 'he won't be there long' if he's 'hostile'

image.altText: Night time photo of Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: The stakes are again high for the steel town of Whyalla as a billionaire owner who has broken past promises looks to a green future.

title.children: Whyalla's billionaire owner Sanjeev Gupta is under pressure on a global scale and it's making steelworkers nervous

image.altText: A young woman with red hair smiles as she looks into the distance.

props.synopsis: With elections looming across the nation, the focus on housing in Tasmania's poll suggests governments are ready to take more radical steps to deal with our housing crisis.

title.children: 'No deposit' home loans, the end of Airbnb and immense rental protections all on the table in an election that could set the scene for other states

image.altText: A man in a white business shirt sitting at a microphone. In the background is a wall of red circle logos that say Radio Brisbane

props.synopsis: The freshly re-elected Lord Mayor Adrian Schrinner told ABC Radio Brisbane it would be up to the state government to pay to connect the Olympic athletics site to public transport.

title.children: 'A major Olympic venue with no transport': Brisbane lord mayor says state should pay for upgrades

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Police concluded their search of bushland south of Ballarat on Wednesday afternoon after being unable to locate any trace of the missing woman.

title.children: Police unable to find Samantha Murphy after intelligence prompted new search south of Ballarat

image.altText: A man outside a car

props.synopsis: New data reveals the worst states and territories in Australia for car thefts, home invasions and other crimes during the last financial year.

title.children: With 55,000 cars stolen across Australia last financial year, ABS figures reveal household crimes are rising in Qld and NT

image.altText: Alleged murder victim Will Swinbourne drinking from a glass

props.synopsis: Police have charged two men who they allege conspired to rob a man of drugs before he was allegedly stabbed in an undercover car park on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Police allege pair conspired to rob Gold Coast man before fatal stabbing

image.altText: A firefighter looking through the front window of a truck at a house engulfed by flames.

props.synopsis: Fire and Rescue New South Wales has recorded more than 60 lithium-ion battery fires in the state so far in 2024.

title.children: Beachside homes evacuated as another suspected lithium-ion battery fire destroys house

image.altText: Four people look at the camera, two have been blurred, and the unblurred people are smiling.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's shadow family violence minister Steve Edgington has suspended a staffer in his electorate office after revelations he had been jailed for domestic violence offences.

title.children: NT politician suspends staffer jailed for DV offences

image.altText: A court build with a columned verandah and a blue coloured building behind

props.synopsis: Andrew Donald Steele pleads guilty to the persistent sexual abuse of a child outside of Australia after Australian Border Force (ABF) officials found files on his phone during a baggage examination.

title.children: SA man pleads guilty to persistent sexual abuse of child overseas

image.altText: alexander csergo smiling at the camera, he is the australian man who was accused of foreign interference

props.synopsis: Alexander Csergo has spent nearly a year in custody after he was arrested in Bondi in April last year, accused of reckless foreign interference.

title.children: Crown drops allegation Sydney businessman prejudiced Australia's national security

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong met with her Chinese counterpart Wang Yi this morning for diplomatic talks — as it happened.

title.children: Protesters clash with police outside Chinese embassy in response to foreign minister's visit — as it happened

image.altText: three men walking while pointing in front of suncorp stadium

props.synopsis: Steven Miles ordered a review into Olympic venues to get better value for money. Now the price tag's the same, but there'll be no world class stadium.

title.children: The $2.7b price tag's the same, but now there'll be no world class stadium for Brisbane's Olympic Games

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, Mark Dreyfus Labor party room _O6A8332

props.synopsis: The debate over LGBT staff and students in religious schools is back this week. We don't have a specific proposal, but what do we know?

title.children: What is the religious discrimination debate about?

image.altText: Fire damage to a cottage style home in Townsville.

props.synopsis: Police have established a crime scene after a house fire in the Townsville suburb of Hermit Park and commended the bravery of three men who attempted to rescue a person inside.

title.children: One dead, 'courageous' neighbours, firefighter, hospitalised after Queensland house fire

image.altText: An illustration of a woman on a sofa leans into a robot

props.synopsis: For centuries, human societies have been supercharged by the arrival of disruptive technology so remarkable they changed the trajectory of human history. The next one has already arrived.

title.children: 'The greatest heist of all time': What life will be like when the singularity takes hold

image.altText: NSW police generic; blue and red lights on top of Newcastle car

props.synopsis: Constable Yun Lin, 42, has been suspended with pay after she allegedly stole a number of items including a luxury handbag and jewellery while on the job in Sydney.

title.children: Sydney police officer accused of stealing  Louis Vuitton purse, jewellery and cash while on duty

image.altText: headshot of Casey Demko wearing blue

props.synopsis: For 15 years, Casey says doctors told her the pain she was experiencing was normal. Finding 'Dr Jenny' finally led her to answers.

title.children: Doctors said my period pain was normal. I finally found help after 15 years

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock holds her hand up while speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The RBA appears to have learnt from past mistakes by opening up its interest rate options while it waits to see if its November rate rise tipped Australia's economy into a worrying downward spiral.

title.children: 'We can't rule anything out': Why the RBA suddenly opened the door to interest rate cuts

image.altText: A crowd of people at a music festival.

props.synopsis: Pill testing is already available in some countries, including New Zealand and parts of Europe. So far, Canberra's Groovin the Moo music festival was the first in Australia to trial it.

title.children: A festival where two people died will be the first in Queensland to introduce pill testing over Easter

image.altText: A large white house with red tiled roof and Indian flag out the front.

props.synopsis: Seema Shergill worked seven days a week for 17.5 hours a day between April 2015 and May 2016. She received $3,400 in a bank account she did not have access to in Australia.

title.children: 'Egregious and exploitative': India's former high commissioner to Australia must pay penalty to worker who earned under $10 a day

image.altText: A crowd of people line up with luggage

props.synopsis: The Coalition has argued for domestic travellers to be compensated when airlines delay or cancel flights, or when their luggage is lost or damaged in transit, as their 'Pay on Delay' bill is debated in the Senate.

title.children: Travellers should be paid for cancelled or delayed flights and lost luggage, Coalition argues

image.altText: A bird's eye view of two swimmers freeing a turtle from nets floating in water

props.synopsis: It's rare to see leatherback turtles at all, but Sydney lifeguards have freed two of the endangered species from nets in one day, with both heading safely back out to sea.

title.children: Sydney lifeguards cut two rarely seen leatherback turtles from shark nets on the same day

image.altText: A very frail little baby girl

props.synopsis: Watin was a happy and healthy two-year-old before the Israel-Gaza war. Now her mother fears she will starve to death before Gaza receives enough humanitarian aid.

title.children: 'Leaving me little by little': Khouloud is watching her daughter starve to death and can't stop it

image.altText: A blonde woman sits on a ride with a little redheaded boy and a blonde boy

props.synopsis: As sons of the sovereign, Harry and William can't totally escape the media, but the way they deal with this interest in their lives couldn't be more different.

title.children: How Harry and William's shared trauma is driving their very different approaches to a common enemy

image.altText: A woman in a black blazer smiles at the camera in front of a fake 'Tasmanien government' background

props.synopsis: Staff at a media company that produces satirical political videos are warned they could face jail time and a fine over a video that shows Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff's face, as it could be seen as "advertisement".

title.children: 'Honest Government Ad' posted by satirical media company censored following complaint to Tasmanian Electoral Commission

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton appear in a graphic with religous inconography.

props.synopsis: The opposition says it wants to see the legislation to enshrine new protections for LGBT students and teachers before making any commitment, after the government said it would prefer to abandon the reforms than trigger a fractious debate.

title.children: Liberals say it's 'very difficult' to back unseen religious discrimination laws, as government threatens to ditch LGBT student protections

image.altText: A group photo of Queen Elizabeth and her grandchildren, with circles marking up errors in editing

props.synopsis: The picture, released in April last year, shows the former monarch surrounded by some of her grandchildren and great-grandchildren.

title.children: Another Royal photograph found to have been edited following Princess Kate controversy

image.altText: Cortnee Vine

props.synopsis: Cortnee Vine gets a call up to the Matildas for their April friendly against Mexico as the team builds towards the Paris Olympics.

title.children: World Cup hero Cortnee Vine returns to Matildas squad as preparations for Paris Olympics build

image.altText: A blurred photo of the share trading boards at the Australian stock exchange

props.synopsis: Wall Street is soaring ahead of a decision on rates by the US Federal Reserve while, here in Australia, the ASX ends lower on Wednesday, the day after our central bank left rates on hold.

title.children: ASX ends lower day after RBA leaves interest rates on hold, while Godfreys shuts up shop for good — as it happened

image.altText: Two ladies wearing feathered and formal attire sit in a dimly lit room.

props.synopsis: The Museum of Old and New Art (MONA) likes to make a statement – and its 'ladies-only' lounge does just that. But now it's the subject of an anti-discrimination legal fight, brought by a male visitor.

title.children: 'Escaping the patriarchy', or discrimination against men? The legal fight over a ladies-only lounge
